intro: Adenosma, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Adenosma species typically grow as herbaceous perennials, often with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Some species are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
